alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:11PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Boulder County through 100 PM MDT... At 1211 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crisman, or 28 miles northwest of Denver, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boulder, Lafayette, Louisville, Wallstreet, Salina, Crisman, Eldorado Springs, Gold Hill, Sunshine and Summerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
